senses.sense_definition: A person skilled at carpentry, the trade of cutting and joining timber in order to construct buildings or other structures.

examples.text: The <w>carpenter</w> measured the wooden beams carefully before cutting them.
We decided to hire a <w>carpenter</w> to build a custom bookshelf for the living room.
The large <w>carpenter</w> buzzed loudly around the eaves of the old barn.
Unlike honeybees, the <w>carpenter</w> makes tunnels in wood to lay its eggs.

senses.sense_definition: A senior rating in ships responsible for all the woodwork onboard.

examples.text: The ship's <w>carpenter</w> was tasked with repairing the damaged hull after the storm.
In the age of sail, the <w>carpenter</w> played a vital role in keeping the vessel seaworthy.
In some regions, a woodlouse is locally known as a <w>carpenter</w>.
The child found a small <w>carpenter</w> crawling under the damp log.

senses.sense_definition: A surname originating as an occupation derived from the trade name carpenter.

examples.text: Among the celebrities she considers part of her generation is the singer Sabrina <w>Carpenter</w>.
Mr. <w>Carpenter</w> has been teaching history at the high school for twenty years.

senses.sense_definition: A number of places in the United States.

examples.text: They drove through the small town of <w>Carpenter</w> on their way across the state.
The community of <w>Carpenter</w> is located in a rural part of the county.

senses.sense_definition: To work as a carpenter, cutting and joining timber.

examples.text: He <w>carpentered</w> for many years to save enough money for his own house.
She spent the summer <w>carpentering</w> on various restoration projects in the village.
